The wilderness and the solitary place shall be glad for them; and the desert shall rejoice, and blossom as the rose.

It shall blossom abundantly, and rejoice even with joy and singing: the glory of Lebanon shall be given unto it, the excellency of Carmel and Sharon, they shall see the glory of the LORD, <FI>and<Fi> the excellency of our God.
Strengthen ye the weak hands, and confirm the feeble knees.

Say to them <FI>that are<Fi> of a fearful heart, Be strong, fear not: behold, your God will come <FI>with<Fi> vengeance, <FI>even<Fi> God <FI>with<Fi> a recompence; he will come and save you.<RF>fearful: Heb. hasty<Rf><CM>
Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.
Then shall the lame <FI>man<Fi> leap as an hart, and the tongue of the dumb sing: for in the wilderness shall waters break out, and streams in the desert.

And the parched ground shall become a pool, and the thirsty land springs of water: in the habitation of dragons, where each lay, <FI>shall be<Fi> grass with reeds and rushes.<RF>grass…: or, a court for reeds, etc<Rf>

And an highway shall be there, and a way, and it shall be called The way of holiness; the unclean shall not pass over it; but it <FI>shall be<Fi> for those: the wayfaring men, though fools, shall not err <FI>therein<Fi>.<RF>but…: or, for he shall be with them<Rf>
No lion shall be there, nor <FI>any<Fi> ravenous beast shall go up thereon, it shall not be found there; but the redeemed shall walk <FI>there<Fi>:
And the ransomed of the LORD shall return, and come to Zion with songs and everlasting joy upon their heads: they shall obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sighing shall flee away.<CM>
